item.title: Making it Easy to Find the Right Library Space
item.dc:creator: Tab McDaniel
item.description:
The web team is excited to share our new library spaces page, scheduled to launch next Friday, December 8th. The new design brings our find a study space and find a computer lab information together, rather than repeating information across two different pages as we do now. This update makes it easier ...

Read moreMaking it Easy to Find the Right Library Space

item.title: Summon Beta Launched, Staff Feedback Breakdown
item.dc:creator: Tab McDaniel
item.description:
Today we’re going live with our Summon Beta Our home page has been updated with a prominent call-to-action, inviting site visitors to explore our beta home page with global search, and complete a short survey. Library Staff Survey Results Collections and the Web Team couldn’t have gotten this far without ...

Read moreSummon Beta Launched, Staff Feedback Breakdown

item.title: Melvyl Now Works with EZproxy
item.dc:creator: Tab McDaniel
item.description:
We partnered with CDL to fix a long-standing usability issue with with Melvyl. An off-network visitor might be prompted to sign in to UCSF Library before viewing search results. Unfortunately, following this prompt sent the user to our full text information page, instead of giving them an easy way to log in and ...

Read moreMelvyl Now Works with EZproxy

item.title: Website Updates: Library Site Header & Footer
item.dc:creator: Tab McDaniel
item.description:
As most of you know, the Web Team is using an iterative approach to the Library site redesign: we launched a pretty good version of the site, and make incremental improvements as we learn more about what is/is not working for our users. With that in mind, we will introduce changes to ...

Read moreWebsite Updates: Library Site Header & Footer

item.title: CDL Request for Feedback: Changes to UC-eLinks
item.dc:creator: Tab McDaniel
item.description:
Some of you guys have already received announcements from CDL about the introduction of their new UC-eLinks sidebar panel, which will replace the current design of a UC-eLinks frame sitting on top of an article. The change is scheduled to go live to all UC campuses on April 17, 2017. The Web ...

item.title: Website Updates: Searching, Profiling, Making, Reserving
item.dc:creator: Tab McDaniel
item.description:
So much happening on the Library website! Let’s dive in, shall we? New Page: Makers Lab The web team worked closely with Dylan and Kemi to give the Makers Lab more of a presence on the site. We’re very happy with the new Makers Lab page, and will continue updating it ...

item.title: Website Update: Staff Directory & Profile Pages
item.dc:creator: Tab McDaniel
item.description:
The web team has published an improved Staff Directory. The updated directory table can now be sorted and filtered, and fixes a problem with how information from this page displays in search results. We’ll bring this improved table format to the Study Spaces and Computer Labs pages as well. Alongside the improved directory, we’re ready to roll ...

Read moreWebsite Update: Staff Directory & Profile Pages

item.title: Library Website Redesign – We’d Love Your Feedback
item.dc:creator: Tab McDaniel
item.description:
Michele and I are pleased to share the beta version of our redesigned Library website. With a few exceptions (listed below), everything from the current site has been recreated on beta. We’ve streamlined content where it made sense, and made the most sought-after information easier to find. Still to be done: Forms Individual staff profiles ...

Read moreLibrary Website Redesign – We’d Love Your Feedback

item.title: Help Test our Search Prototype
item.dc:creator: Tab McDaniel
item.description:
Michele announced the launch of our working search prototype in the #website Slack channel last week: Hi everyone! You’ve seen the prototype, but now we’d like to share the actual functioning search. This is an interim solution that will be used until we pilot the Summon search solution, but it should ...

Read moreHelp Test our Search Prototype

item.title: Website Redesign: Getting a Handle on Our Information Architecture
item.dc:creator: Tab McDaniel
item.description:
We’ve already posted a few times about evaluating and refining our content for maximum scannability (on the web, scanning is the new reading). Today I want to share how the web team is working to better organize and structure our content for maximum findability. In other words, we need to get a grip on our information architecture (IA). Information ...

Read moreWebsite Redesign: Getting a Handle on Our Information Architecture
